findings.title: ST - Stops Transactions
findings.description: The transactions are initially disabled for all users excluding the authorized addresses. The owner can enable the transactions for all users. Once the transactions are enabled the owner will not be able to disable them again.

findings.title: OCTD - Transfers Contract's Tokens
findings.description: The contract owner can claim all the balance of the contract by calling the `swapBack` function and enabling the `rescueSwap` variable, potentially draining the contract's tokens without resetting the `tokensForLiquidity` and `tokensForMarketing` variables.

findings.title: DDP - Decimal Division Precision
findings.description: Division of decimal numbers can result in rounding errors due to Solidity's implementation of division, leading to issues with precise calculations and potential loss of funds.

findings.title: RSW - Redundant Storage Writes
findings.description: The contract performs redundant storage writes when the provided parameter matches the current state of the variables, leading to unnecessary gas consumption and inefficiencies in contract execution.

findings.title: MEE - Missing Events Emission
findings.description: The contract performs actions and state mutations from external methods that do not result in the emission of events.

findings.title: RED - Redundant Event Declaration
findings.description: The contract declares certain events in its code. However, these events are not emitted within the contract's functions. As a result, these declared events are redundant and serve no purpose within the contract's current implementation.

findings.title: RRS - Redundant Require Statement
findings.description: The contract utilizes a `require` statement within the `add` function aiming to prevent overflow errors, but this check is redundant due to Solidity version 0.8.0 and later reverting on overflow and underflow, leading to extra gas costs and increased complexity without providing additional security.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of the SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases gas consumption unnecessarily since Solidity versions greater than or equal to 0.8.0 have native functionality that replaces it.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that are initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: Non-conformance to Solidity naming conventions can lead to decreased readability and maintainability of the code.

findings.title: L05 - Unused State Variable
findings.description: An unused state variable is a state variable that is declared in the contract, but is never used in any of the contract's functions.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Events are a way to record and log information about changes or actions that occur within a contract.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L13 - Divide before Multiply Operation
findings.description: Performing divisions before multiplications may cause loss of precision.

findings.title: L15 - Local Scope Variable Shadowing
findings.description: Local scope variable shadowing occurs when a local variable with the same name as a variable in an outer scope is declared within a function or code block.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: The contract performs operations on variables configured by user-supplied input without proper checks for zero values, leading to potential problems during execution.

findings.title: L19 - Stable Compiler Version
findings.description: The contract does not lock the pragma version, which may lead to deployment with an unexpected version, producing vulnerabilities and undiscovered bugs.
